summary: The Fair-Value Accounting and Budget Act amends the Congressional Budget and Impoundment Control Act of 1974 to require fair-value estimates for federal loan and loan guarantee programs. The bill mandates the Congressional Budget Office (CBO) to provide fair-value estimates, which will be used to determine compliance with budget enforcement requirements. The Office of Management and Budget (OMB) will submit annual reports on fair-value estimates. The definition of fair value is based on a Government Accounting Standards Board publication.
